nodes.name: Execute Workflow Trigger
nodes.notes:
PROD trigger: Receives update payload from Job Runner.
Input: { req: { tenant_id, update, trace_id, correlation_id } }
Output: Same item passed through.
WHY passthrough: Accepts any shape from caller, processes raw Telegram update.

nodes.name: IF — Correlation ID Exists
nodes.notes:
Check if req.correlation_id was provided.
Input: { req: { ... } }
Output true: correlation_id exists, pass through.
Output false: need to generate correlation_id.
WHY: correlation_id required for tracing; generate if missing per CTX spec.

nodes.name: Crypto — Generate UUID
nodes.notes:
Generate UUID for correlation_id when not provided.
Input: Item without correlation_id.
Output: { data: '<uuid>' } added to item.
WHY: No Code node for UUID generation per project rules.

nodes.name: Set — Assign Generated Correlation ID
Set — Build _ctx
nodes.notes:
Build _ctx object for correlation and ErrorPipe.
Input: { req: { tenant_id, update, trace_id, correlation_id } }
Output: Adds _ctx.workflow, _ctx.tenant_id, _ctx.trace_id, _ctx.correlation_id, _ctx.contracts.errorpipe.
WHY: _ctx required for ErrorPipe v1 and meta in SuccessEnvelope.

nodes.name: Switch — Update Kind
nodes.notes:
Route based on update_kind.
Input: { _parsed: { update_kind: '...' }, ... }
Outputs: 0=message, 1=edited_message, 2=channel_post, 3=edited_channel_post, 4=my_chat_member, 5=chat_member, 6=other(fallback).
WHY: Different update types require different processing paths.

nodes.name: Set — Prepare User Upsert
nodes.notes:
Prepare fields for tg.users upsert.
Input: { _parsed: { from_user: {...} }, ... }
Output: Adds tg_user_id, is_bot, first_name, etc. for Postgres upsert.
WHY: Map Telegram user to tg.users schema.

nodes.name: PG — Upsert tg.users
nodes.notes:
Upsert sender user into tg.users.
Input: tg_user_id, is_bot, first_name, etc.
Output: Upserted row or error.
WHY: Persist user for message attribution. Idempotent by tg_user_id PK.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Upsert tg.users
nodes.notes:
Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.
Input: Error item from PG node.
Output: Adds _err.node, _err.operation, _err.table.
WHY: ErrorPipe requires explicit source identification.

nodes.name: Set — Prepare Chat Upsert
nodes.notes:
Prepare fields for tg.chats upsert.
Input: { _parsed: { chat_id, chat_type, chat: {...} }, ... }
Output: Adds chat_id, chat_type, title, etc.
WHY: Map Telegram chat to tg.chats schema.

nodes.name: PG — Upsert tg.chats
nodes.notes:
Upsert chat into tg.chats.
Input: chat_id, chat_type, title, etc.
Output: Upserted row or error.
WHY: Persist chat for message context. Idempotent by chat_id PK.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Upsert tg.chats
nodes.notes:
Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.
Input: Error item from PG node.
Output: Adds _err.node, _err.operation, _err.table.
WHY: ErrorPipe requires explicit source identification.

nodes.name: PG — Select Existing Message
nodes.notes:
Check if message already exists by natural key (tenant_id, chat_id, message_id).
Input: _ctx.tenant_id, _parsed.chat_id, _parsed.message_id
Output: Existing message row or empty.
WHY alwaysOutputData=true: Need to handle both cases (exists/not exists) without breaking flow.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Select Message
nodes.notes:
Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.
Input: Error item from PG node.
Output: Adds _err.node, _err.operation, _err.table.
WHY: ErrorPipe requires explicit source identification.

nodes.name: IF — Message Exists
nodes.notes:
Check if message already exists in tg.messages.
Input: Select result with id field or empty.
Output true: Message exists, need to create new version.
Output false: New message, insert message first.
WHY: Different paths for new message vs edit.

nodes.name: Set — Prepare New Message Insert
nodes.notes:
Prepare fields for new tg.messages insert.
Input: { _ctx, _parsed }
Output: Adds tenant_id, chat_id, message_id, visibility, dm_owner_user_id.
WHY: Map to tg.messages schema for new message.

nodes.name: PG — Insert tg.messages
nodes.notes:
Insert new message into tg.messages.
Input: tenant_id, chat_id, message_id, etc.
Output: Inserted row with id.
WHY skipOnConflict=true: Idempotent by unique (tenant_id, chat_id, message_id).

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Insert Message
nodes.notes:
Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.
Input: Error item from PG node.
Output: Adds _err.node, _err.operation, _err.table.
WHY: ErrorPipe requires explicit source identification.

nodes.name: Set — New Message FK (version 1)
nodes.notes:
Set message_fk and version_no=1 for new message.
Input: { id: <new message id>, ... }
Output: Adds _message_fk, _version_no=1.
WHY: New message always starts at version 1.

nodes.name: PG — Select Max Version
nodes.notes:
Get current max version_no for existing message.
Input: message_fk (id from tg.messages)
Output: { version_no } or empty.
WHY: Need to increment version for edited message. alwaysOutputData handles empty result.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Select Version
nodes.notes:
Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.
Input: Error item from PG node.
Output: Adds _err.node, _err.operation, _err.table.
WHY: ErrorPipe requires explicit source identification.

nodes.name: Set — Existing Message FK (next version)
nodes.notes:
Set message_fk and increment version_no for edited message.
Input: { version_no, ... } from select or empty.
Output: Adds _message_fk from prior IF node, _version_no = current + 1.
WHY: Edited message gets next version number.

nodes.name: Set — Prepare Version Insert
nodes.notes:
Prepare fields for tg.message_versions insert.
Input: { _message_fk, _version_no, _parsed, _content_sha256, req.update }
Output: All version fields mapped from parsed data.
WHY: Map Telegram message content to tg.message_versions schema.
NOTE: entities/caption_entities are NOT written separately (n8n Set node cannot handle arrays as 'object' type). They remain accessible via payload jsonb column.

nodes.name: PG — Insert tg.message_versions
nodes.notes:
Insert message version into tg.message_versions.
Input: All version fields.
Output: Inserted row with id.
WHY: Persist version content. Unique by (message_fk, version_no).
NOTE: entities/caption_entities excluded (n8n limitation with arrays). Source: payload jsonb.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Insert Version
nodes.notes:
Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.
Input: Error item from PG node.
Output: Adds _err.node, _err.operation, _err.table.
WHY: ErrorPipe requires explicit source identification.

nodes.name: Set — Store Version ID
nodes.notes:
Store inserted version ID for later use.
Input: { id: <version id> }
Output: Adds _version_id.
WHY: Need version ID to update tg.messages.current_version_id and for attachments.

nodes.name: PG — Update messages.current_version_id
nodes.notes:
Update tg.messages.current_version_id to point to new version.
Input: _message_fk, _version_id
Output: Updated row.
WHY: Keep current_version_id in sync after each version insert.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Update Message
nodes.notes:
Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.
Input: Error item from PG node.
Output: Adds _err.node, _err.operation, _err.table.
WHY: ErrorPipe requires explicit source identification.

nodes.name: IF — Has File Attachments
nodes.notes:
Check if message has file attachments to persist.
Input: { _attachments: { files_count } }
Output true: Has files, process attachments.
Output false: No files, skip to URL processing.
WHY: Only run file persistence if files exist.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Upsert File
nodes.notes: Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.

nodes.name: PG — Upsert tg.file_instances
nodes.notes:
Upsert file instance into tg.file_instances.
Input: _file.file_id, file_unique_id
Output: Upserted row.
WHY: Track file_id -> file_unique_id mapping. file_id is PK.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Upsert File Instance
nodes.notes: Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.

nodes.name: PG — Insert tg.message_attachments
nodes.notes:
Insert file attachment linking version to file.
Input: _version_id, _file details
Output: Inserted row.
WHY: Link message version to discovered files.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Insert Attachment
nodes.notes: Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.

nodes.name: IF — Has URLs
nodes.notes:
Check if message has discovered URLs.
Input: { _attachments: { urls_count } }
Output true: Has URLs, persist to content.urls.
Output false: No URLs, skip.
WHY: Only process URLs if found.

nodes.name: PG — Upsert content.urls
nodes.notes:
Upsert discovered URL into content.urls.
Input: _url
Output: Upserted row.
WHY: Deduplicate URLs by normalized_url (unique constraint).

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Upsert URL
nodes.notes: Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.

nodes.name: Set — SuccessEnvelope (Message)
nodes.notes:
Build SuccessEnvelope for message-like updates.
Input: { _ctx, _parsed, _message_fk, _version_id, _attachments }
Output: SuccessEnvelope per I/O contract.
WHY: Final output format per Contracts canvas.

nodes.name: Set — Prepare Membership Data
nodes.notes:
Prepare fields for membership event insert.
Input: { _parsed.membership_update }
Output: Adds membership_chat_id, membership_user_id, old_status, new_status, etc.
WHY: Map Telegram membership update to tg.chat_member_events schema.

nodes.name: PG — Insert tg.chat_member_events
nodes.notes:
Insert membership event into tg.chat_member_events.
Input: tenant_id, chat_id, tg_user_id, etc.
Output: Inserted row.
WHY: Audit trail of membership changes.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Insert Member Event
nodes.notes: Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.

nodes.name: PG — Upsert tg.chat_memberships_current
nodes.notes:
Upsert current membership status.
Input: tenant_id, chat_id, tg_user_id, status, role_payload
Output: Upserted row.
WHY: Keep current membership state. Idempotent by PK (tenant_id, chat_id, tg_user_id).

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Upsert Membership
nodes.notes: Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.

nodes.name: Set — SuccessEnvelope (Membership)
nodes.notes:
Build SuccessEnvelope for membership updates.
Input: { _ctx, _parsed, membership_chat_id }
Output: SuccessEnvelope per I/O contract.
WHY: Membership updates don't have message_id/version_id.

nodes.name: Set — SuccessEnvelope (Other)
nodes.notes:
Build SuccessEnvelope for 'other' update types.
Input: { _ctx }
Output: SuccessEnvelope with update_kind='other', nulls for message fields.
WHY: No-op for unrecognized update types but still return valid envelope.

nodes.name: Set — Prepare ErrorPipe v1
nodes.notes:
Prepare ErrorPipe v1 payload for WF99.
Input: { _ctx, _err, message/error from PG error output }
Output: { ctx, error_context } per ErrorPipe Contract v1.
WHY: Normalize error format before calling WF99.

nodes.name: Merge — All Error Paths
nodes.notes:
Merge all error outputs from Postgres nodes.
Input: Multiple error streams from different PG nodes (13 original + 2 job insert errors).
Output: Single error stream for ErrorPipe preparation.
WHY: Centralize error handling. numberInputs=15 for all PG error outputs.

nodes.name: Execute Workflow — WF99
nodes.notes:
Call WF99 Global Error Handler.
Input: { ctx, error_context, message, error, etc. }
Output: ErrorEnvelope from WF99.
WHY: Centralized error handling per ErrorPipe Contract v1. No StopAndError after - returns ErrorEnvelope.

nodes.name: Merge — All Success Paths
nodes.notes:
Merge all success outputs (message, membership, other).
Input 1: Message success envelope.
Input 2: Membership success envelope.
Input 3: Other success envelope.
Output: Final SuccessEnvelope.
WHY: Single exit point for success. numberInputs=3.

nodes.name: Manual Trigger (TEST)
nodes.notes:
TEST trigger for manual testing.
Input: None.
Output: Triggers test case switch.
WHY: Allows testing without Job Runner.

nodes.name: Set — Test Happy Data
nodes.notes:
Happy path test data: new message with URL.
Input: None.
Output: { req: { tenant_id, update, trace_id, correlation_id } }
WHY: Tests complete message+URL flow. Uses test IDs (-999xxx).

assignments.name: req.update

nodes.name: Set — Test Edge Data
nodes.notes:
Edge case test data: edited message.
Input: None.
Output: { req: { tenant_id, update (edited_message), ... } }
WHY: Tests edit flow with version increment.

assignments.name: req.update

nodes.name: Set — Test Fail Data
nodes.notes:
Fail path test data: triggers error.
Input: None.
Output: { req: { update with null user id } }
WHY: Tests error handling path with invalid data.

nodes.name: Merge — Test Cases
nodes.notes:
Merge test case outputs.
Input 0: Happy path data.
Input 1: Edge case data.
Input 2: Fail case data.
Output: Single item for correlation check.
WHY: Converge test paths before main flow.

nodes.name: Set — Prepare Job File Fetch
nodes.notes:
Prepare ops.jobs payload for fetch_tg_file.
Input: { _file, _ctx, _message_fk, _version_id, _parsed }
Output: Adds _job_file object with payload fields via dotNotation.
Payload contract: tg_file_id, file_unique_id, file_kind, message_version_id, chat_id, visibility.
WHY: Create background job to fetch file content from Telegram. No object literals per project rules.

nodes.name: PG — Insert ops.jobs (File)
nodes.notes:
Insert fetch_tg_file job into ops.jobs.
Input: { _job_file }
Output: Inserted row.
WHY: Queue file download for background processing.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Insert Job File
nodes.notes:
Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.
Input: Error from job insert.
Output: Adds _err metadata.
WHY: Identify error source for WF99.

nodes.name: Set — Prepare Job URL Fetch
nodes.notes:
Prepare ops.jobs payload for fetch_url.
Input: { _url, _ctx, _message_fk, _version_id, _parsed, db.url }
Output: Adds _job_url object with payload fields via dotNotation.
Payload contract: url_id, url, message_version_id, chat_id, visibility.
WHY: Create background job to fetch URL content. No object literals per project rules.

nodes.name: PG — Insert ops.jobs (URL)
nodes.notes:
Insert fetch_url job into ops.jobs.
Input: { _job_url }
Output: Inserted row.
WHY: Queue URL fetch for background processing.

nodes.name: ERR — Source PG Insert Job URL
nodes.notes:
Tag error source for ErrorPipe v1.
Input: Error from job insert.
Output: Adds _err metadata.
WHY: Identify error source for WF99.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap PG — Upsert tg.users
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.user namespace.
Input: PG result.
Output: { db.user: {...db fields...} }
WHY: Prevent collision with working item fields during merge.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After PG — Upsert tg.users
nodes.notes:
Restore working item after PG � Upsert tg.users.
Input 0: Original working item with _ctx/_parsed/req.
Input 1: Wrapped DB result (db.user).
Output: Merged item with all context + DB result.
WHY: PG nodes only return DB fields, losing working context.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap PG — Upsert tg.chats
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.chat namespace.
Input: PG result.
Output: { db.chat: {...db fields...} }
WHY: Prevent collision with working item fields during merge.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After PG — Upsert tg.chats
nodes.notes:
Restore working item after PG � Upsert tg.chats.
Input 0: Original working item with _ctx/_parsed/req.
Input 1: Wrapped DB result (db.chat).
Output: Merged item with all context + DB result.
WHY: PG nodes only return DB fields, losing working context.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap PG — Select Existing Message
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.existing_msg namespace.
Input: PG result.
Output: { db.existing_msg: {...db fields...} }
WHY: Prevent collision with working item fields during merge.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After PG — Select Existing Message
nodes.notes:
Restore working item after PG � Select Existing Message.
Input 0: Original working item with _ctx/_parsed/req.
Input 1: Wrapped DB result (db.existing_msg).
Output: Merged item with all context + DB result.
WHY: PG nodes only return DB fields, losing working context.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap Insert tg.messages
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.new_message namespace.
Input: PG result.
Output: { db.new_message: {...db fields...} }
WHY: Prevent collision with working item fields during merge.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After Insert tg.messages
nodes.notes:
Restore working item after PG — Insert tg.messages.
Input 0: Original working item with _ctx/_parsed/req.
Input 1: Wrapped DB result (db.new_message).
Output: Merged item with all context + DB result.
WHY: PG nodes only return DB fields, losing working context.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap Select Max Version
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.max_version namespace.
Input: PG result.
Output: { db.max_version: {...db fields...} }
WHY: Prevent collision with working item fields during merge.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After Select Max Version
nodes.notes:
Restore working item after PG — Select Max Version.
Input 0: Original working item with _ctx/_parsed/req.
Input 1: Wrapped DB result (db.max_version).
Output: Merged item with all context + DB result.
WHY: PG nodes only return DB fields, losing working context.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap Insert tg.message_versions
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.version namespace.
Input: PG result.
Output: { db.version: {...db fields...} }
WHY: Prevent collision with working item fields during merge.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After Insert tg.message_versions
nodes.notes:
Restore working item after PG — Insert tg.message_versions.
Input 0: Original working item with _ctx/_parsed/req.
Input 1: Wrapped DB result (db.version).
Output: Merged item with all context + DB result.
WHY: PG nodes only return DB fields, losing working context.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap Update messages.current_version_id
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.update_result namespace.
Input: PG result.
Output: { db.update_result: {...db fields...} }
WHY: Prevent collision with working item fields during merge.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After Update messages.current_version_id
nodes.notes:
Restore working item after PG — Update messages.current_version_id.
Input 0: Original working item with _ctx/_parsed/req.
Input 1: Wrapped DB result (db.update_result).
Output: Merged item with all context + DB result.
WHY: PG nodes only return DB fields, losing working context.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap Upsert content.urls
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.url namespace.
WHY: Preserve _ctx/_url/_message_fk/_version_id after URL upsert.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After Upsert URLs
nodes.notes:
Restore working item after URL upsert.
WHY: Need _ctx, _url, _message_fk, _version_id for job creation.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap Upsert tg.files
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.file.
WHY: Preserve _file/_ctx context.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After Upsert tg.files
nodes.notes:
Restore context after PG — Upsert tg.files.
WHY: Need _file, _ctx for downstream operations.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap Upsert tg.file_instances
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.file_instance.
WHY: Preserve _file/_ctx context.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After Upsert tg.file_instances
nodes.notes:
Restore context after PG — Upsert tg.file_instances.
WHY: Need _file, _ctx for downstream operations.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap Insert tg.chat_member_events
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.member_event.
WHY: Preserve _ctx/_parsed/membership_* context.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After Insert tg.chat_member_events
nodes.notes:
Restore context after PG — Insert tg.chat_member_events.
WHY: Need _ctx, _parsed for SuccessEnvelope.

nodes.name: Set — Wrap Upsert tg.chat_memberships_current
nodes.notes:
Wrap PG result into db.membership.
WHY: Preserve _ctx/_parsed/membership_* context.

nodes.name: Merge — Restore After Upsert tg.chat_memberships_current
nodes.notes:
Restore context after PG — Upsert tg.chat_memberships_current.
WHY: Need _ctx, _parsed for SuccessEnvelope.

parameters.value: ={{ JSON.stringify({ text: String($json._parsed?.text || ''), caption: String($json._parsed?.caption || ''), entities: $json._parsed?.entities || null, caption_entities: $json._parsed?.caption_entities || null }) }}

nodes.name: Crypto — SHA256 Content
nodes.notes:
Compute SHA256 hash of message content.
Input: Item with _parsed.text, _parsed.caption, _parsed.entities, _parsed.caption_entities.
Output: Adds _hash_hex field with hex-encoded hash.
WHY: content_sha256 column for deduplication.

nodes.name: Set — Format Content Hash
nodes.notes:
Format hash as PostgreSQL bytea.
Input: _hash_hex from Crypto node.
Output: _content_sha256 = '\x' + hex_hash.
WHY: PostgreSQL bytea column needs \x prefix.

nodes.name: PG — Upsert tg.files
nodes.notes:
Upsert file metadata into tg.files table.
Input: { _file: { file_unique_id, mime_type, file_name, file_size, ... } }
Output success: Upserted row.
Output error: Error object routed to ErrorPipe.
WHY: Store unique file metadata; file_unique_id is natural key per Telegram API.
Error output enabled for ErrorPipe v1 pattern.

nodes.name: Set — Parse job.payload
nodes.notes: Parse req.job.payload (may be string or object from WF90) and extract bot_id, update_id, received_at for DB lookup

nodes.name: PG — Load raw.telegram_updates
nodes.notes: Load raw Telegram update from raw.telegram_updates by bot_id + update_id + received_at

nodes.name: IF — Raw Update Found
nodes.notes: Check if raw.telegram_updates row found (body field exists)

nodes.name: Set — req.update from DB
nodes.notes: Assign loaded body (JSONB) to req.update

assignments.name: _err.message
assignments.value: raw.telegram_updates row not found for payload keys

nodes.name: Set — Error: Raw Update Not Found
nodes.notes: Create error envelope tags for missing raw update

nodes.name: Set — Determine update_kind
nodes.notes: Determine update_kind and extract message-like object (_msg)

nodes.name: Set — Extract Chat Fields
nodes.notes: Extract chat, message ID fields

nodes.name: Set — Extract User & Content
nodes.notes: Extract from_user, sender_chat, text, caption, entities

nodes.name: Set — Extract Dates & Reply
nodes.notes: Extract date, edit_date, reply_to, forward_*

nodes.name: Set — Extract Attachments
nodes.notes: Extract file attachments: document, photo, video, audio, voice, animation, sticker

nodes.name: Set — Extract Membership
nodes.notes: Extract membership_update for my_chat_member or chat_member updates

assignments.name: _parsed.discovered_urls

nodes.name: Set — Extract URLs from Entities
nodes.notes: Extract URLs from text_link and url entities, deduplicate

assignments.name: _attachments.files

nodes.name: Set — Build Files Array
nodes.notes: Build _attachments.files array from parsed attachment objects (document, video, audio, voice, animation, sticker, photo)

nodes.name: Set — Attachment Counts & URLs
nodes.notes: Set files_count, urls array, and urls_count in _attachments

nodes.name: Set — Mark Base Item
nodes.notes: Mark this as the base item (no file/url expansion yet)

nodes.name: Set — Mark File Items
nodes.notes: Mark file items as NOT base (they have _file field)

nodes.name: IF — Has File
nodes.notes: Check if item has _file (file expansion happened)

nodes.name: IF — Is Base Item (for URLs)
nodes.notes: Only expand URLs for the base item to avoid duplicates

nodes.name: Set — Extract URL String
nodes.notes: Extract _url string from _url_obj

nodes.name: Item Lists — Split Files
nodes.notes: Split _attachments.files array into individual items, each with _file field. If no files, output single item.

nodes.name: Item Lists — Split URLs
nodes.notes: Split _attachments.urls array into individual items. Only processes base item.

main.node: Merge — Restore After PG — Upsert tg.users
Merge — Restore After PG — Upsert tg.chats
Set — Wrap PG — Select Existing Message
Merge — Restore After Select Max Version
ERR — Source PG Upsert File Instance
ERR — Source PG Insert Member Event
ERR — Source PG Insert Job File
ERR — Source PG Insert Job URL
Merge — Restore After PG — Upsert tg.users
Merge — Restore After PG — Upsert tg.chats
Merge — Restore After PG — Select Existing Message
Merge — Restore After PG — Select Existing Message
Merge — Restore After Select Max Version
Set — Error: Raw Update Not Found
